summary: Build a modern, responsive Hospital Management System (HMS) web app adapted for the Internet Computer platform: React + TypeScript frontend, Motoko canister backend, Internet Identity auth, role-based dashboards (Patient/Doctor/Admin), appointment booking, and in-app notifications (no SMTP/SMS).
architectural_notes: Platform adaptation: backend in Motoko canister(s); frontend in React+TypeScript (Vite) with Tailwind; data stored in canister (no MySQL/MongoDB).
Authentication via Internet Identity; application-level role mapping for Patient/Doctor/Admin authorization.
Email/SMS notifications are not available; implement in-app notification system instead.
Reminder logic must use an ICP-compatible scheduling approach rather than node-cron/SMTP integrations.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication in the frontend and connect it to the Motoko canister so users can sign in/out and the app can reliably identify the current user principal.

Implement role-based access control with roles Patient, Doctor, and Admin, including a backend role mapping from principal -> role(s) and frontend route/page gating so each role can only access its own dashboard and permitted actions.

Build the Patient experience: patient registration/profile management, browse doctor list/detail, book an appointment by selecting doctor/date/time, view upcoming appointments and appointment history, and view in-app notifications.

Build the Doctor experience: view today’s and upcoming appointment schedules, view patient details for appointments, update appointment status, and add medical notes or prescriptions associated with an appointment.
Build the Admin/Management experience: manage doctors, staff, and patients; manage appointments; and show dashboard analytics including totals and appointment statistics.

Implement appointment reminders as in-app notifications that are triggered 24 hours and 1 hour before an appointment using an ICP-compatible approach (no SMTP/SMS, no traditional cron). Notifications must be created once per reminder window and must not duplicate.

Create a clean, responsive hospital-themed UI/UX with a blue/white palette: landing page, navigation with login/register entry points, role-specific dashboards, and footer with contact information. Use modern cards layout and subtle animations.
Add generated static image assets for the HMS UI (logo and landing hero illustration) and render them in the frontend from static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Add admin UI to view and add nurses, analogous to the existing “Manage Doctors” panel, and integrate it into the Admin Dashboard.
Add an admin UI control to trigger demo staff seeding from the dashboard so an admin can populate doctors and nurses quickly for demo/testing.

new_feature_requests.summary: Set up ICP-compatible project architecture (React+TS+Vite/Tailwind frontend, Motoko backend canister) with folder structure and core scaffolding
Implement authentication via Internet Identity and role-based access control (Patient/Doctor/Admin role mapping)
Patient features: registration/profile, browse doctor details, book appointments, view appointment history, view in-app notifications
Doctor features: view patient details, view schedules, update appointment status, add medical notes/prescriptions
Admin features: manage doctors/staff/patients, manage appointments, view dashboard analytics (totals and stats)
Appointment reminders and alerts implemented as in-app notifications (24h and 1h before) with platform-appropriate scheduling approach
Define data model/schema for patients, doctors, staff, appointments, notes/prescriptions, notifications stored in canister stable data
Create REST-like canister interface/API (Motoko methods) and corresponding frontend service layer; include validation and error handling
Design and implement clean hospital-themed UI/UX (blue/white), landing page, nav/login/register, responsive dashboards, footer, modern cards/animations

Define and implement the backend data model in Motoko for: Patients, Doctors, Staff, Appointments, Appointment Status, Medical Notes/Prescriptions, and Notifications, with stable storage so data persists across canister upgrades.

Create a Motoko canister interface (RPC-style methods) and a corresponding frontend service layer to support: browsing doctor details, patient profile, appointment booking, appointment history, doctor schedule, admin management actions, and notifications; include input validation and structured error handling.
Add staff management/seed data: create and manage staff records including doctors and nurses (e.g., add initial staff entries for testing/demo)
Extend the backend data model and API to support nurses as staff members, alongside existing doctors, so the system can store and retrieve nurse records.
Add an admin-only backend method to seed a small set of demo staff entries (multiple doctors and multiple nurses) for testing/demo, without creating duplicates when called multiple times.
